results.title: Norway the Slow Way
results.abstract: A journey in which I travel north, on the world’s most beautiful voyage, searching for the specter of my grandfather and a glimpse of the ever-elusive midnight sun.

results.title: 36 Hours in Milan
results.abstract: With new museums and restaurants, and an ambitious center-city development nearing completion, the future is already on display in Milan.

media.caption: Offerings at Officine del Gelato; view of the Duomo, right, from the Giacomo Arengario restaurant at the new Museo del Novecento; at El Brellin in Navigli, a hot night-life destination.
media.copyright: Chris Warde-Jones for The New York Times

results.title: 36 Hours in Copenhagen
results.abstract: During a weekend in the Danish capital, discover art underground, sample dishes from a former Noma chef and unwind in the city’s green spaces.

media.caption: A sandwich at Almanak, which is on the ground floor of the Standard building.
media.copyright: Chris Carmichael for The New York Times

media.caption: Lidkoeb, a new bar.
media.copyright: Chris Carmichael for The New York Times

results.title: A $100 Weekend in Chicago
results.abstract: Sample everything from pizza to pancakes, classical music to the blues, during a frugal-friendly weekend in the Windy City.

media.caption: Light fades during a performance by the Chicago Symphony Orchestra in Millennium Park. The author's seat was a good distance from the performers, but he swears they were there.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times

media.caption: The $4.99 lunch special at Pequod’s Pizza included a molten pie and a free soda.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times

media.caption: The Lincoln Park Conservatory.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Travel and Vacations;Emotions;Anxiety and Stress;Anger (Emotion);Sleep;Psychology and Psychologists
results.title: A Recipe for Air Rage
results.abstract: Stressed passengers packed into cramped cabins can bring emotions to a boil. But the situation isn’t all bleak — there are ways to make the best of a volatile situation.

media.copyright: Boris Kulikov
Boris Kulikov

results.title: 36 Hours in Berkeley, Calif.
results.abstract: Go for an idyllic campus stroll, take in wide-open panoramas, sample international flavors and catch some culture during a weekend in this Bay Area college town.

media.caption: The Lawrence Hall of Science.
media.copyright: Oresti Tsonopoulos for The New York Times

media.caption: Chez Panisse.
media.copyright: Oresti Tsonopoulos for The New York Times

results.title: 52 Places to Go in 2014
results.abstract: From No. 1 Cape Town all the way to No. 52 Niagara Falls, N.Y., explore the vibrant cities and spectacular coastlines, unexpected spots and new attractions that made our list this year.

results.title: 36 Hours in Florence, Italy
results.abstract: See the skyline without battling crowds, sample pastries from a secret gem, sip artisanal beers and soak up culture during a weekend in the Tuscan capital.

results.abstract: The city is a bastion of craft brews that gain character from time spent in bourbon barrels.

results.title: Finding Your Travel Tribe
results.abstract: Which review site speaks to who you are as a traveler?

results.adx_keywords: Travel and Vacations;Savannah (Ga);Blacks;Slavery;Race and Ethnicity;Evans, Walter O;Civil Rights and Liberties;Georgia
results.title: Savannah, Both Sides
results.abstract: Beneath its trademark Southern charm is a city with stories of slavery and civil rights struggles.

media.caption: Laurel Grove South Cemetery in Savannah, a significant burial ground for local African-Americans.
media.copyright: Adam Kuehl for The New York Times

media.caption: Walter O. Evans, a Savannah-born African-American art collector. A wing at the Savannah College of Art and Design bears his name and houses his art.
media.copyright: Adam Kuehl for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Skiing;Hikes and Hiking;Travel and Vacations;Wanaka (New Zealand)
results.title: New Zealand for Beginners
results.abstract: Finding himself in a country he’d never given much thought, the author manages to hurtle down slopes, go on a picturesque “tramp” and hit some pubs — all in a few days.

media.caption: The Cardrona Alpine Resort on New Zealand's South Island.
media.copyright: Andrew Quilty for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Budget Travel;Vancouver (British Columbia);San Juan Islands (Wash);Portland (Ore);Travel and Vacations
results.title: In the Northwest, 3 Trips, Planned by Others
results.abstract: The Frugal Traveler surrenders itinerary control and follows the orders of others through Vancouver, the San Juan Islands and Portland, Ore.

media.caption: Clockwise from left: a view from Lopez Island, part of the San Juan Islands; Vancouver's Gastown area; the author smokes a cigar in Portland, Ore.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times; Kiran Herbert (cigar)

media.caption: The bosses for the Vancouver leg: Peter and Judy Kugel, the author's parents.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times

media.caption: The Vancouver Leg | Clockwise from top left: a view from Queen Elizabeth Park; the Marine Building; and looking out over the city from the Galley Patio and Grill.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times

media.caption: The boss for the San Juan Islands leg: Caroline Gonzalez, the author's friend and Queens neighbor.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times

media.caption: The San Juan Islands Leg | Clockwise from top left: Produce at a farmers' market on Orcas Island; a view from Mount Constitution; a handful of goodies grown on Lopez Island; a late afternoon water view.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times

media.caption: The boss for the Portland leg: Kiran Herbert, a writer the author is working with.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times

media.caption: The Portland Leg | Clockwise from top left: Dosas from the Tiffin Asha food cart; polenta at Tasty n Sons; and Punchbowl Falls, outside of Portland.
media.copyright: Seth Kugel for The New York Times
Seth Kugel for The New York Times; Kiran Herbert (cigar)

results.title: The Art of Slowing Down in a Museum
results.abstract: Instead of hunting masterpieces at a fevered clip, spending more time with fewer works just might make for a better visit.

media.caption: Fighting for a snapshot of the Mona Lisa at the Louvre. Some psychologists suggest that taking a slower, more contemplative approach at museums could make visitors more likely to connect with the art.
media.copyright: Guia Besana for The New York Times

media.caption: A gallery at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. Sandra Jackson-Dumont, who oversees education programs at the museum, said you could make a sprawling museum digestible and personal by seeking out only those works that dovetail with your interests.
media.copyright: Todd Heisler/The New York Times

results.title: 36 Hours: Central Park, New York
results.abstract: Spot birds and gaze at stars, explore gardens and go for a row, snack on a roof and sway to some jazz during a weekend in the city’s sanctuary.

results.title: 36 Hours in Athens
results.abstract: The city’s self-confidence and creativity are stirring again after years of tough press that defined Athens as a beleaguered capital.

media.caption: Six d.o.g.s., a cafe-bar and arts space.

results.title: Giving the Paris Cafe Scene a Jolt
results.abstract: Over the last few years, more than a dozen new-generation coffee spots have emerged, offering alternatives to cookie-cutter Parisian cafes.

media.caption: Loustic opened last year in the Third Arrondissement.
media.copyright: Agnes Dherbeys for The New York Times

media.caption: “We are trying to educate the public that coffee is exactly like wine,” said Channa Galhenage, who opened Loustic.
media.copyright: Agnes Dherbeys for The New York Times

media.caption: Boot Café opened earlier this year in a former cobbler's shop.
